website_summaries.verdict: Taller buyers requiring an extra-long dressing stick will find their match in this affordable model.
pros: 28-inch stick is a great pick for taller customers
Buyers appreciated the bended push-and-pull hook, making the unique design easy to use
cons: Metal in hooks has a tendency to bend
Buyers wished the product came with instructions on how to properly use the item

customer_reviews.title: Using a dressing stick....
customer_reviews.text: I have frozen syndrome in both shoulders due to my work. It's difficult and time consuming getting dressed everyday. Since I bought the dressing stick, it's been a wonderful help for me. It helps so much and takes less time, once you get used to using the dressing stick. I would recommend this dressing stick for anyone who has shoulder and/or arm problems. Get it from RMS, I did.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: BIGGEST SURPRISE!
customer_reviews.text: Of the many items suggested in the "hip kit" for after hip replacement surgery, this one was the biggest surprise! I thought oh well, I'll get it, and probably not use it, but It has proven to be the most useful tool. The larger hook side helps with getting undies and pants on when you cannot bend, and also is a great tool to pick up things, or grab shoes. The smaller hook has proven invaluable in assisting with getting shoes on, as even with elastic laces they need the back pulled up, or tongue pulled out. Anyone with mobility issues, or facing hip or knee surgery should definitely purchase one!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: RMS 28 Inch Long Dressing Stick
customer_reviews.text: A well made, solid dressing stick. This is a much better construction than the dressing stick that came in the "hip kit" I received several years ago. The vinyl covering on the attachments is nice and thick and should last a good, long time. The attachments are firmly and securely anchored into the stick' s ends. The stick is thoroughly and smoothly sanded. I love the fact that it's made in America! I would definitely buy again. I'm very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: JinglepawsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I fractured my femur and had a partial hip replacement. I am not allowed to bend that leg more than 90 degrees at the hip for several months which makes some challenges for dressing. This works perfectly for getting my affected leg into pants and then pulling the pants up high enough to reach without violating the 90 degree rule. Between this stick ad a sock puller I can dress completely independently with no violation of the rule.
customer_reviews.author: D Toth

customer_reviews.title: Better Than The Hospital Standard Issue Dressing Stick
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace the one that came home with me from the hospital. Its slightly larger diameter, it has a reinforcing metal ferule at both ends of the stick, the hook is vinyl coated so its less likely to scratch your skin, and the compound bent wire thing on the opposite end is a little stronger looking. However, be careful pushing hard on it because the compound bent wire thing is offset from the centerline of the stick, so it will bend sideways unless you're careful.
customer_reviews.author: Johann

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review, but Amazon did not publish it. I'll try again. This product is a joke! It has a cup hook at one end and a jacket/hat hook at the other. You could go to a hardware store and build one yourself for a couple of dollars. I can't believe people still buy this product after reading the reviews. I did not even send mine back, went in to the garbage and the producers got to keep my money. Wasn't even worth sending back! If Amazon doesn't publish this then I'll never believe Amazon's reviews again.
customer_reviews.author: DAYLE P

customer_reviews.title: Not a zipper helper.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a single 30 year old with nobody around to help me zip up my dresses when I need help. I decided to buy a zipper helper to help me. I searched for zipper helper and this came up. BY FAR THIS DOES NOT HELP YOU ZIP ANY ZIPPER. Its just not made for zipping zippers. This is more for getting into your shoes and grabbing a shirt hung high. Frankly its just too large.
customer_reviews.author: AnythingCathleen

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and needed.
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't going to order this for my post-hip replacement recovery. But I am SO glad I did as it has been a real life-saver in putting on and taking off pants. I also use it for taking off my anklets and my shoes. The hook is handy to pick up dropped pieces of clothing, too. Oh, and since I am a lady and am now unable and will be unable for a long while to reach to my calf and my ankle on the surgery leg, I devised a way to shave my legs by rubber-banding my disposable razor onto the bottom part by the hook and was able to shave my legs. Happy day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but not made with best materials
customer_reviews.text: I knew when I first received this dressing stick that it was going to eventually break. And today it finally did. It lasted seven months before breaking. I really liked it while it lasted. It's a really good concept, it's just not sturdy enough for everyday use. Had to give it a two star rating because it didn't last long. For $15 it should have lasted longer than seven months. I'm going to shop around and see if I can find something similar only built more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Cockerell

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful dressing aid
customer_reviews.text: I'm.stii getting used to using the dressing stick. My non-dominant hand is currently ravaged with a gout flare. I am able to use the stick to make sure that the heel strap to the cracks I wear are flat instead of being twisted. I am able to remove my socks without my wife's help. That being said, I'm still having some problems using the stick to help me pull up my pants. I'm sure that will come with more practice.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Dancer

customer_reviews.title: A must have dressing stick
customer_reviews.text: Just had total hip replacement and this dressing stick is a life saver and a must have. I wasn't able to get pants or shorts or underwear on by myself till I received this. If you're going to have hip surgery be sure you order this in advance so you have it ready when you come home. Makes a great difference on the road back to independence.
customer_reviews.author: Ileene

customer_reviews.title: It is just perfect for attaching the straps and seatbelt
customer_reviews.text: I do not find anything that is wrong with my stick. I use it for not only dressing but Also for arranging my straps to my electronic wheelchairwhile losded I’m my wheelchair equipped van. It is just perfect for attaching the straps and seatbelt . It is almost like it was made for this purpose.it hooks the straps to the wheelchair seat receptors and is ideal for attaching the seatbelts to the appropriate receptors.i have one in the van permanently & one by my recliner at home. The “Stick” is perfect for the many things. Associated with a mobile electric wheelchair .tQS

customer_reviews.title: This thing is VERY nice. It helps out in so many ways not ...

Only one minor issue is the wood handle. Mine works great, but watch the weight that you pick up with it; so it wont break.mine has not broke thus so far. I think that i will go and add another one to my listafter i get through here. cjp
customer_reviews.author: cjp

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, saves bending over
customer_reviews.text: I love this helper. I have 3 around the home. I use them for stuff I drop, dog pads, things on the floor or that roll under cabinets or the dresser. It really saves moving, bending, pushing small items. You don't know how much you will end up using this thing. I open and close plantation shutters, open and close drapes. Pull shoes over to our on. D Saves on bending a lot. You will get more than one once you realize the usefulness of it. Get the longer one first.
customer_reviews.author: Marybeth M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and very useful for anyone with back, hip or knee surgery
customer_reviews.text: Just had a total knee replacement on my right knee and I wish now I had gotten this when I had my back surgery. At first I wasn't sure how to use the different hooks, but after a few minutes of experimenting I'm able to get dressed and undressed just about as fast as before my surgery. Excellent quality shaft, and the hooks have a nice thick plastic coating on them so I'm expecting it to last quite a while
customer_reviews.author: NCBob

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for someone with mobility problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mom to try. She can't bend very far forward and has a hard time dressing. She has always used the base of her 4-legged cane and been pretty good with it. However, it's getting harder for her now. I bought this and had her try it (she never likes anything new or different). To my surprise, she uses it daily now and really likes it. I finally found something that will help her and she will actually use.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M. House-bundy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for snug fitting socks
customer_reviews.text: Not good for snug fitting socks. The weak wire flexes and becomes bent and breaks after minimal usage. Needs to be more ridged Save your money on this one

customer_reviews.title: I bought these sticks for a different application-curtain wand. ...

I have cordless honeycomb top-down and bottom-up blinds all throughput our house. But our windows are tall so it is difficult for me to get the top down/up. These sticks however work perfectly and allow me to get the blinds up and down at ease.

customer_reviews.title: Very thankful..

This was recommended by an Occupational Therapist at Kaiser Hospital and I've been so thankful for the recommendation. Pretty sturdy and have had no problems with bending or breaking so far.

customer_reviews.title: Helpful product.

customer_reviews.title: A great item during a difficult time.

Also is good at helping me pull my socks off, which is very difficult for me to do on my own. I highly recommend this product.

Most helpful..excellent product and great price.
